page.title: 11VILLAGE HALL
page.content: CHEDZOY VILLAGE HALL WAS BUILT IN 1937,LARGELY THROUGH THE EFFORTS OF THE REV.MULLENS,THE RECTOR.HIS COMMEMORATIVE PORTRAIT HANGS IN THE HALL OVER THE FIREPLACE.A KITCHEN,REPLACING THE STAGE,WAS BUILT IN THE 1970'S.A TRUST, LEFT BY SYDNEY MASON COLLINS,WHOSE EQUESTRIAN MEMORIAL STANDS IN THE CHURCHYARD,WILL ONE DAY PAY FOR FURTHER IMPROVEMENTS.THE HALL BECAME A REGISTERED CHARITY ON 23.3.72 AND IS RUN BY A BOARD OF TRUSTEES.THERE ARE 7 ELECTED MEMBERS FROM GROUPS IN THE VILLAGE AND 8 REPRESENTATIVE MEMBERS, 2 FROM THE PARISH COUNCIL,2 FROM THE PAROCHIAL CHURCH COUNCIL, FROM THE WOMEN'S GROUP,2 FROM THE YOUTH CLUB. COSTS P.A.ARE:Â£250 ELECTRICITY,Â£25 WATER/SEWERAGE,Â£25 PERFORMING RIGHTS, Â£150 CLEANING,Â£67 INSURANCE.INCOME IS Â£329 FROM LETTING,Â£75 FROM THE COUNCIL
